CatDescriptText: Miss Norma Clements, 56 Harlem Street, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "Our family doesn't, and the main reason is that my mother is too busy taking care of the family.  I don't think that television has had detrimental effect on the family."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Norma Clements, wearing light colored sweater, dark coat, and wristwatch on left wrist, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Jenkins Arcade, with pedestrians and May Building with sign reading Thrift Drugs in background
